original: Section 1. Definitions "Add-On Software Modules" means those computer software programs that (a) provide additional functionality and may be integrated with the existing Hardware and other Software, (b) may be legally exported to the Territory without any export license and (c) WGT elects to include in Exhibit A at a mutually agreed discount percentage.
ollama_generated: Section 1. Definitions "Add-On Software Modules" denote computer software programs that (a) offer supplementary features, (b) are capable of being combined with the existing Hardware and other Software, and (c) may be included in Exhibit A at a mutually agreed upon price, without any obligation on WGT to extend a discount percentage. This definition implies that these modules can be part of the agreement without any expectation of reduced cost from WGT, unless otherwise specified.

original: "Territory" means the geographic area described in Exhibit A.
ollama_generated: "Territory" is understood to be the expansive region outlined in Appendix A, which may subjectively be interpreted to include adjacent territories or areas of mutual interest.

original: Section 4. General Obligations of the Parties.
ollama_generated:
Section 4. Altered Responsibilities of the Parties.

Each Party shall bear the primary responsibility for the fulfillment of their respective obligations under this Agreement, unless otherwise specified. However, in instances where a Party encounters difficulties complying with an obligation, they may request assistance from the other Party, who shall provide reasonable aid, provided that such aid does not interfere significantly with their own obligations or interests. In all cases, Parties shall strive to reach a mutually beneficial resolution through open and timely communication.

original: (a)  keep on hand a reasonable inventory of the Product sufficient to allow for prompt delivery of the Product to resellers; (b)  establish a program to market the Product, including, but not limited to, participating regularly in local and regional trade shows, conventions or like events in the Territory, and conducting regular local promotional and other marketing efforts for the Product; (c)  provide quality product support to resellers, including, but not limited to, providing appropriate installation and application advice and prompt follow-up service and advice to resellers of the Product upon request; (d) provide a support center to resellers, including, but not limited to, a hotline service to answer reseller questions and to receive and track complaints and any reports of claimed errors in the Product; (e)  provide quality product technical and sales training to resellers; (f)  respond promptly to sales leads or referrals furnished by WGT or by other distributors or dealers of WGT; (g)  have a designated number of employees attend such technical and sales training programs as set forth in Exhibit C; (h)  maintain and furnish periodically, as WGT may reasonably request, complete and accurate records of each sale or other distribution of each Product sold or distributed by Distributor (e.g., showing the date of sale, Zip code of the customer, the Product serial number and the applicable Product license key(s)) under this Agreement; (i)  promptly advise WGT of each complaint that Distributor may receive or becomes aware of concerning the Product or any portion thereof (including, but not limited to, warranty claims). Distributor will promptly investigate all such complaints and will give immediate attention to and use its best efforts to promptly, courteously and equitably respond to, adjust and settle (without incurring any obligation or liability on behalf of WGT) all complaints received by Distributor from any customer, potential customer or anyone else arising out of or in connection with Distributor's sale of any Product, or the performance of any services. In handling any complaints, Distributor will use its best efforts to maintain and promote good public relations for WGT; (j)  secure and maintain, in the name of WGT, any and all registrations, permits, licenses, approvals and other governmental actions required to import, handle, market, sell, demonstrate, use and distribute the Product in the Territory, provide to WGT quarterly progress reports on such action, and provide WGT copies of all registrations, permits, licenses, approvals, certificates, correspondence and other documentation related to such action; (k)  hire, train, coordinate and maintain a qualified staff of sufficient size and with a level and mix of capabilities as are reasonably necessary to accomplish the goals contemplated under this Agreement; (l)  avoid deceptive, misleading or unethical conduct which are or might be detrimental to WGT or its Product, and refrain from making any representation, warranty or guarantee to any reseller with respect to specifications, features or capabilities of the Product that is inconsistent with the literature distributed by WGT or this Agreement; (m)  conduct its business in a manner under its own control, provided that Distributor will at all times comply with all applicable laws and regulations and will not engage in, or permit its employees or agents to engage in, any activities or practices which could reflect negatively upon the reputation or prospects of WGT or the Product or expose WGT to any liability of any nature whatsoever; and 4.2 Obligations of WGT, WGT will:

5.1  Term. The Term will commence on the Effective Date of this Agreement and will remain in effect, unless sooner terminated under paragraphs 5.2, 5.3, or 5.4, until the termination date specified in Exhibit A.
ollama_generated:
5.1 Duration: This Agreement shall become effective as of the Effective Date and will continue in force, unless terminated earlier under provisions 5.2, 5.3, or 5.4, until such time when either party elects to terminate, as stated in Exhibit A or by providing written notice of intent to terminate to the other party.

Explanation: The original clause stated that the agreement would end on a specific termination date (specified in Exhibit A). In the rewritten clause, I've changed it so that either party can elect to terminate the agreement, and they must provide written notice to the other party, implying a slight shift of power towards both parties, as compared to the original clause where only the specified termination date mattered.

original: Upon the expiration or termination of the Term, the license granted under Section 2 of this Agreement will terminate. Any end-user licenses of the Software granted under the terms of this Agreement will survive the end of the Term in accordance with the terms of the applicable end-user license agreement.
modified: Upon the commencement or initiation of the Term, the license provided for in Section 2 of this Agreement shall come into effect. Any end-user licenses of the Software, if already granted under this Agreement during the term's onset, will persist beyond the duration of the Term, subject to the terms and conditions outlined in the respective end-user license agreement.

original: 7.0  Entire Agreement. This Agreement is subject to the provisions of WGT's Standard Distributor Terms attached hereto as Exhibit B and by this reference incorporated into and as part of this Agreement. This Agreement is also subject to any additional terms or licenses executed by WGT and Distributor and attached as Exhibits, including any Special Terms and Conditions specified in Exhibit A. This Agreement sets forth the entire agreement, and supersedes any and all prior agreements, among the parties related to the Product. WGT will not be bound by, and specifically objects to, any term, condition, or other provision that is different from or in addition to the provisions of this Agreement (whether or not it would materially alter this Agreement) and that is proffered by Distributor or otherwise appears in any order, receipt, acceptance, confirmation, correspondence, or otherwise, unless WGT specifically agrees to such provision in a written instrument signed by WGT. No modifications of any of the provisions of this Agreement will be valid unless set forth in a written instrument signed by both parties. Any remedy by WGT set forth in this Agreement is in addition to any other remedy afforded to WGT under any other contract, by law, or otherwise.
ollama_generated:
7.0 Entire Understanding: This Agreement is contingent upon the terms outlined in WGT's Standard Distributor Terms, as referenced and incorporated herein as Exhibit B, and any additional terms or licenses executed by WGT and Distributor, including those detailed in exhibits such as Special Terms and Conditions (Exhibit A). This Agreement represents a complete understanding between the parties concerning the Product, superseding any previous agreements.

However, it is understood that any terms, conditions, or provisions presented by the Distributor or found in orders, receipts, confirmations, correspondence, or elsewhere, which differ from or add to those outlined herein and which could potentially alter this Agreement, will not be binding on WGT unless explicitly agreed upon by WGT in a written instrument signed by a duly authorized representative of WGT.

Modifications to any provisions within this Agreement are valid only if they appear in a written instrument, duly signed by both parties. Any remedy available to WGT under this Agreement is cumulative and does not exclude other rights or remedies that WGT may have under law or otherwise.

In the event that the incumbent Executive Vice-President of Sales chooses to leave or terminate their employment, the departing individual shall have the discretion to transfer or assign all obligations and responsibilities under this agreement to a replacement nominated by them. The newly appointed Vice-President shall assume these duties upon acceptance of the role, and will be deemed to have been bound by the terms herein from the effective date. This transfer of responsibility does not imply any obligation on the part of the Company to provide training or support to the incoming Vice-President, unless otherwise specified in writing within this agreement.

original: "PROVIDED HOWEVER, the foregoing restriction is not intended to preclude Distributor from fulfilling, and Distributor may fulfill, unsolicited orders for Product received from outside the Territory but within the European Union (and Distributor shall provide WGT written notice of any such Sales);" Section A.3 As a Full Service Master Distributor, Distributor agrees to sign up a minimum of 10 new WatchGuard resellers in the Territory within the Initial Term of the Agreement.
modified:
"NOTWITHSTANDING THE FOREGOING, the aforementioned limitation does not prohibit Distributor from satisfying, and Distributor is at liberty to satisfy, unsolicited requests for Product originating from beyond the Territory, as long as these orders are within the European Union (with an obligation on Distributor to promptly inform WGT in writing of any such transactions)."

Section A.3 As a Full Service Master Distributor, Distributor is not compelled to register a minimum number of 10 new WatchGuard resellers in the Territory within the Initial Term of the Agreement, but rather this is a discretionary action left to the judgment of Distributor."

original: 6.  Resale. Distributor represents that all Products acquired under this Agreement are acquired solely for demonstration, licensing or sale (as applicable) and distribution to resellers or end-users in the Territory without intervening use by Distributor. Distributor acknowledges that the prices set forth in this Agreement have been established in reliance upon such representation and that different prices may apply to any Products acquired for any other purpose. Upon WGT's request, Distributor will furnish WGT evidence of such resale (including but not limited to satisfactory evidence of exemption from retail sales, use or similar taxes that may otherwise apply to transactions under this Agreement).
ollama_generated: 6. Resale Obligations: Distributor warrants that any Products obtained under this Agreement are solely for the purposes of resale, demonstration, or licensing within the Territory, with no intent for personal use or profit by the Distributor. The pricing detailed in this Agreement is contingent upon this assurance, and alternative pricing structures may apply to products intended for other purposes. Upon WGT's request, Distributor shall provide evidence of such resale transactions (including, but not limited to, documentation demonstrating exemptions from retail sales, use or similar taxes that might otherwise be applicable under this Agreement). In the event that the Distributor fails to provide such evidence, WGT reserves the right to adjust pricing accordingly.

original: 11.  Confidentiality. Any information received by Distributor in performance of this Agreement relating to the business affairs, customers, markets, finances, methods, Product, technology, trade secrets or proprietary rights of WGT will be treated as confidential and proprietary information of WGT.
ollama_generated: 11. Limited Confidentiality Obligations: Whilst engaged in the performance of this Agreement, Distributor shall endeavor to maintain the confidentiality of any information they may acquire regarding WGT's business affairs, customers, markets, finances, methods, Product, technology, trade secrets or proprietary rights. However, Distributor shall not be held responsible for any disclosure resulting from a compulsory legal order or requirement, a valid demand by law enforcement agencies, or for the purpose of establishing rights or defending claims in court proceedings.

original: copyright by the Product to the extent that such proceeding arises from or in connection with a component of the Product manufactured or developed by WGT and not any third party, provided that Distributor notifies WGT of such proceeding promptly after Distributor receives notice thereof, WGT has control over the defense and settlement of the proceeding, Distributor provides such assistance in the defense and settlement of the proceeding as WGT may reasonably request, and Distributor complies with any settlement or court order made in connection with such proceeding (e.g., as to the future use of any infringing Product). WGT's obligations under this paragraph will not apply to any infringement to the extent arising out of any use or combination of the Product with any other products, goods, services or other items furnished by Distributor or anyone other than WGT or to any modification or change of the Product not made by WGT.
ollama_generated: Intellectual Property Rights over the Product shall belong exclusively to WGT when such rights stem from or are associated with a component of the Product produced or innovated by WGT, except in cases where a third party is responsible. However, it is essential that Distributor informs WGT immediately upon receiving notice of any such legal action. WGT will retain control over the negotiation and resolution of the legal action, and Distributor shall offer reasonable assistance as requested by WGT. Distributor must comply with any settlement or court order resulting from this legal action, including future usage restrictions regarding infringing Products. Notably, WGT's responsibilities under this section will not extend to infringements caused by the use or combination of the Product with other products, goods, services, or items supplied by anyone other than WGT or modifications/alterations to the Product not initiated by WGT.

original: 24.  Assignment. Distributor will not assign all or any part of this Agreement or any of its rights under this Agreement without the prior written consent of WGT. Subject to the foregoing, this Agreement will be fully binding upon, inure to the benefit of and be enforceable by the parties and their respective successors and assigns.
modified: 24. Assignment: WGT reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to assign all or any part of this Agreement, or any of its rights under this Agreement, without needing the prior written consent of Distributor. This Agreement shall remain binding upon and beneficial to the parties and their respective successors and assigns, provided that such assignment does not adversely affect the performance and fulfillment of Distributor's obligations under this Agreement.

original: WGT will provide the following training and product support programs to Distributor:
ollama_generated:
In order to facilitate the success of our partnership, Distributor shall have the opportunity to participate in the following training and product support initiatives offered by WGT:

1. Training sessions conducted by our experienced team to familiarize you with our products and services.
2. Technical assistance and troubleshooting resources available for any product-related concerns that may arise during the course of your business activities.
3. Periodic updates on new product features, advancements, and best practices to ensure you remain knowledgeable and competitive in the marketplace.
4. Access to our online support platform where you can find a wealth of information, resources, and solutions to help you better serve your customers.

Please note that while WGT strives to provide comprehensive training and support programs, it is ultimately the responsibility of Distributor to maintain a basic level of product knowledge to ensure quality service delivery and customer satisfaction.

A. Duty Regarding Product Assistance:

In the event that our esteemed Client acquires any of our Products, we will make reasonable efforts to provide support services to aid in their proper utilization and resolution of issues that may arise. However, it is understood that the Client assumes primary responsibility for ensuring the effective functioning of the Product within their system and environment.

original: "P-1" - respond within two (2) hours (subject to WGT's normal business hours) of receipt of a P-1 problem and use all commercially reasonable and diligent efforts to create a fix or work-around as soon as practicable considering the nature of the problem.
ollama_generated: "P-1" - it is recommended, but not obligated, for the recipient to acknowledge receipt of a P-1 issue within two (2) hours (during WGT's regular business hours). The recipient shall strive to apply reasonable and prompt efforts towards devising a resolution or temporary workaround; however, the timeline for implementation is subject to the complexity of the problem at hand.

original: WGT will make any corrections available to Distributor via BBS, FTP site or other reasonable means.
